refnamediv.refpurpose: Get double value of a variable

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.simpara: Returns the double (floating point) value of var.
See also intval, strval, settype and Type juggling.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Determine whether a variable is set

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: This is the opposite of (boolean) var, except that no warning is generated when the variable is not set. See converting to boolean for more information.
refsect1.simpara: Note that this is meaningless when used on anything which isn't a variable; i.e. empty (addslashes ($name)) has no meaning since it would be checking whether something which isn't a variable is a variable with a &false; value.
See also isset and unset.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Get the type of a variable

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Returns the type of the PHP variable var.

warning.simpara: Never use gettype to test for a certain type, since the returned string may be subject to change in a future version. In addition, it is slow too, as it involves string comparision .

refsect1.para:
Possibles values for the returned string are:
"boolean" (since PHP 4)
"integer"
"double"
"string"
"array"
"object"
"resource" (since PHP 4)
"null" (since PHP 4)
"user function" (PHP 3 only, deprecated)
"unknown type"
For PHP 4, you should use function_exists and method_exists to replace the prior usage of gettype on a function.
See also settype, is_array, is_bool, is_double, is_integer, is_null, is_numeric, is_object, is_resource, is_scalar and is_string.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Returns an array of all defined variables

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: See also get_defined_functions.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Get integer value of a variable

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.simpara: Returns the integer value of var, using the specified base for the conversion (the default is base 10).
var may be any scalar type. You cannot use intval on arrays or objects.

note.para: The base argument for intval has no effect unless the var argument is a string.

refsect1.simpara: See also doubleval, strval, settype and Type juggling.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Finds whether a variable is an array

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Returns &true; if var is an array, &false; otherwise.
See also is_double, is_float, is_int, is_integer, is_real, is_string, is_long, and is_object.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Finds out whether a variable is a boolean

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Returns &true; if the var parameter is a boolean.
See also is_array, is_double, is_float, is_int, is_integer, is_real, is_string, is_long, and is_object.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Finds whether a variable is a double

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Returns &true; if var is a double, &false; otherwise.
See also is_array, is_bool, is_float, is_int, is_integer, is_real, is_string, is_long, and is_object.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Finds whether a variable is a float

refnamediv.refpurpose: Find whether a variable is an integer

refnamediv.refpurpose: Find whether a variable is an integer

refnamediv.refpurpose: Finds whether a variable is an integer

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Returns &true; if var is an integer (long), &false; otherwise.
See also is_bool, is_double, is_float, is_int, is_real, is_string, is_object, is_array, and is_integer.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Finds whether a variable is &null;

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Returns &true; if var is null, &false; otherwise.
See also is_bool, is_double, is_numeric, is_float, is_int, is_real, is_string, is_object, is_array, and is_integer.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Finds whether a variable is a number or a numeric string

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Returns &true; if var is a number or a numeric string, &false; otherwise.
See also is_bool, is_double, is_float, is_int, is_real, is_string, is_object, is_array, and is_integer.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Finds whether a variable is an object

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Returns &true; if var is an object, &false; otherwise.
See also is_bool, is_long, is_int, is_integer, is_float, is_double, is_real, is_string, and is_array.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Finds whether a variable is a real

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.simpara: This function is an alias for is_double.
See also is_bool, is_long, is_int, is_integer, is_float, is_double, is_object, is_string, and is_array.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Finds whether a variable is a resource

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: is_resource returns &true; if the variable given by the var parameter is a resource, otherwise it returns &false;.
See the documentation on the resource-type for more information.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Finds whether a variable is a scalar

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: is_scalar returns &true; if the variable given by the var parameter is a scalar, otherwise it returns &false;.

note.para: is_scalar does not consider resource type values to be scalar values. This behavior is intentional: Resources are abstract datatypes which are currently based on integers. This implementation detail should not be relied upon, as it may change.

refsect1.para: See also is_bool, is_double, is_numeric, is_float, is_int, is_real, is_string, is_object, is_array, and is_integer.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Finds whether a variable is a string

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Returns &true; if var is a string, &false; otherwise.
See also is_bool, is_long, is_int, is_integer, is_float, is_double, is_real, is_object, and is_array.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Determine whether a variable is set

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.simpara: Returns &true; if var exists; &false; otherwise.
See also empty and unset.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Prints human-readable information about a variable

refentry.refsect1:
Description
void print_r mixed expression
This function displays information about the values of variables in a way that's readable by humans. If given a string, integer or double, the value itself will be printed. If given an array, values will be presented in a format that shows keys and elements. Similar notation is used for objects.
Remember that print_r will move the array pointer to the end. Use reset to bring it back to beginning.
&tip.ob-capture;
Compare print_r to var_dump.
<?php $a = array (1, 2, array ("a", "b", "c")); print_r ($a); ?>
This function will continue forever if given an array or object that contains a direct or indirect reference to itself or that contains an array or object on a deeper level that does so. This is especially &true; for print_r($GLOBALS), as $GLOBALS is itself a global variable and contains a reference to itself as such.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Generates a storable representation of a value

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.simpara: serialize returns a string containing a byte-stream representation of value that can be stored anywhere.
This is useful for storing or passing PHP values around without losing their type and structure.

To make the serialized string into a PHP value again, use unserialize. serialize handles all types, except the resource-type. You can even serialize arrays that contain references to itself. References inside the array/object you are serializeing will also be stored.

note.para: In PHP 3, object properties will be serialized, but methods are lost. PHP 4 removes that limitation and restores both properties and methods. Please see the Serializing Objects section of Classes and Objects for more information.

example.title: serialize example

refsect1.para: See Also: unserialize.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Set the type of a variable

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Set the type of variable var to type.

Possibles values of type are:
"boolean" "integer" "double" "string" "array" "object"
Returns &true; if successful; otherwise returns &false;.

example.title: settype example
example.programlisting:
$foo = "5bar"; // string $bar = &true;; // boolean
settype($foo, "integer"); // $foo is now 5 (integer) settype($bar, "string"); // $bar is now "1" (string)

refsect1.para: See also gettype, type-casting and type-juggling.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Get string value of a variable

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.simpara: Returns the string value of var. See the documentation on string for more information on converting to string.
var may be any scalar type. You cannot use strval on arrays or objects.
See also doubleval, intval, settype and Type juggling.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Creates a PHP value from a stored representation

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.simpara: unserialize takes a single serialized variable (see serialize) and converts it back into a PHP value. The converted value is returned, and can be an integer, double, string, array or object. If an object was serialized, its methods are not preserved in the returned value.

note.para: In PHP 3, methods are not preserved when unserializing a serialized object. PHP 4 removes that limitation and restores both properties and methods. Please see the Serializing Objects section of Classes and Objects or more information.

example.title: unserialize example

refsect1.para: See Also: serialize.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Unset a given variable

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: unset destroys the specified variables. Note that in PHP 3, unset will always return &true; (actually, the integer value 1). In PHP 4, however, unset is no longer a &true; function: it is now a statement. As such no value is returned, and attempting to take the value of unset results in a parse error.

example.title: unset example

refsect1.para: The behavior of unset inside of a function can vary depending on what type of variable you are attempting to destroy.
See also isset and empty.
